p: Medicinal plants have played an important role in the life of people across the globe. To date, traditional medicine practitioners (TMP) are primarily considered as the first-line healthcare providers in a rural community. The frequent use of traditional herbal medicine is often ascribed to the failure of orthodox treatment. Africa is one of the continent richly endowed with medicinal plants ( Mgbeahuruikea et al., 2019) and Nigeria is among the African region that regularly used complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) concurrently with traditional belief for the treatment of various forms of diseases ( Shinkafi et al., 2015).
